negotiator.protocol

Class AlternatingMultipleOffersProtocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • negotiator.protocol.DefaultMultilateralProtocol
      • negotiator.protocol.AlternatingMultipleOffersProtocol
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MultilateralProtocol
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlternatingMajorityConsensusProtocol

    public class AlternatingMultipleOffersProtocol
extends DefaultMultilateralProtocol
    Implementation of an alternating offer protocol using voting consensus.

    Protocol in short: 

     Round 1: Each agent makes their own offer.
 Round 2: Each agent votes (accept/reject) for each offer on the table.
 
 If there is one offer that everyone accepts, the negotiation ends with this offer.
 Otherwise, the process continues until reaching deadline or agreement.

    Detailed description

    The AMOP protocol is an alternating offers protocol in which all players get the same opportunities. That is, every bid that is made in a round is available to all agents before they vote on these bids. This implemented in the following way: The AMOP protocol has a bidding phase followed by voting phases. In the bidding phase all negotiators put their offer on the table. In the voting phases all participants vote on all of the bids on the negotiation table. If one of the bids on the negotiation table is accepted by all of the parties, then the negotiation ends with this bid. This is an iterative process continuing until reaching an agreement or reaching the deadline. The essential difference with the SAOP protocol is that the players do not override the offers made by others and the agents can take all offers into account before they vote on the proposals.

    Author:
    David Festen, Reyhan Aydogan, Catholijn Jonker, W.Pasman modification to improve testability

        public boolean isFinished(Session session,
                          java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        Description copied from interface: MultilateralProtocol
        Check if the protocol is done or still busy. If this method returns true, the SessionManager will not start a new Round after the current one. It will however finish all the turns described in the MultilateralProtocol.getRoundStructure(java.util.List, negotiator.session.Session) method.

      • getCurrentAgreement

        public Bid getCurrentAgreement(Session session,
                               java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        Gets the current agreement if any. This assumes that the session contains Rounds containing offer, votes, offer, votes, etc in this order. An agreement consists an Offer that was Accepted by all the votes. See also acceptedOffer(Round, Round).

      • acceptedOffer

        protected Offer acceptedOffer(Round votingRound,
                              Round offerRound)
        returns the first offer in the given Round that everyone accepted, or null if no such offer.
        Parameters:
        votingRound - the round with the voting (Accept or Reject) actions. The turns in votingRound must contain the following: (N is the number of turns in the offer round)

        vote(party1,offer1), vote(party2, offer1), ..., vote(partyN, offer1), vote(party1, offer2), ......, vote(party1, offerN), ... , vote(partyN, offerN)

        We only consider offers that ALL N parties have voted on.
        offerRound - the round with the offers (one for each party is expected).
        Returns:
        The first accepted offer (all parties accepted the offer) if such an offer exists, null otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the offerRound contains Action(s) not extending Offer

      • nrOfVotes

        protected int nrOfVotes(int numOffers,

                        int offerNumber)
        Parameters:
        numOffers - the number of offers on the table (in each turn)
        turns - all the voting turns
        offerNumber - the offer number that is being checked.
        Returns:
        number of Accepts for given offer number

      • isVotingRound

        protected boolean isVotingRound(Session session)
        Returns whether this is a voting round. First voting round is even round and >= 2.
        Parameters:
        session - the current state of this session
        Returns:
        true is this is an even round > 0.
